definition: to touch (physically, one's feelings etc)/to touch on (a topic)
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions

sentences.english: This attains to the narrative core of the dream.
sentences.chinese: 這一點觸及了夢的表述核心。

sentences.english: They rarely push the government's limits.
sentences.chinese: 他們很少觸及政府的戒條。

sentences.english: So though it is still touching the teeth, it comes back like that.
sentences.chinese: 所以說雖然舌頭仍然觸及牙齒，它卻是在向後移動。

sentences.english: At its best, it illuminates some very dark corners.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是它觸及到了一些最陰暗的角落。

sentences.english: Steam is condensed to water when it touches a cold surface.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽觸及冷的表面即凝結成水。

sentences.english: The faint disdain of her smile seemed to lift her high above her antagonist's reach.
sentences.chinese: 倨傲的笑容似乎使她位於對手無法觸及的高度。

sentences.english: This can only be due to the occasional touch, cite a few side can not but be regrettable omissions.
sentences.chinese: 本文只能因偶爾觸及，略舉數端，不免要掛一漏萬的。

sentences.english: The child-bearing right is related to the gap of China's laws.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯的生育權觸及了我國法律的空白點。

sentences.english: The wire guidance enables torpedo to close into homing contact with the target.
sentences.chinese: 有線制導能夠使魚雷接近致自導引觸及目標。

sentences.english: The possibility of hurting should inspire an augmentation of respect.
sentences.chinese: 不慎觸及了可能觸及之物應倍增尊敬。

sentences.chinese: 不慎觸及了可能觸及之物應倍增尊敬。

sentences.english: They never touch the inner matter.
sentences.chinese: 它們從不觸及內部物質。

sentences.english: Shines with a feel-good, spare text that goes right to the heart of childhood emotions.
sentences.chinese: 用溫馨的隻字片語觸及你內心真實的童年情感。

sentences.english: Science often errs, and that pseudoscience may happen to stumble on the truth.
sentences.chinese: 科學經常犯錯，而僞科學也會偶爾觸及真理。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate applicative value of laparoscopy in children for the diagnosis and treatment of non-palpable testes.
sentences.chinese: 目的評價應用腹腔鏡技術診治未觸及睾丸的應用價值。

sentences.english: The reach of children, with a red back cover back cover.
sentences.chinese: 避免兒童觸及，用後蓋回紅蓋。

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
to rise (i.e. number increases)/a price rise/to raise
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to press close to/to snuggle close/intimate
to expand/to enlarge/to broaden one's scope
to freeze (water etc)/(fig.) to freeze (assets, prices etc)
